news-item.title: UMS Holdings keeps rising: up 13.1% in 6 days
news-item.text:
UMS Holdings Limited (SI:558), Singapore's 26th largest manufacturing company by market capitalisation, extended its gains Monday, rising an additional 1.0c (or 1.4%) to close at 73.50c. The shares have soared 8.50c (or 13.1%) over the past six trading days. Compared with the FTSE/ASEAN 40 Index which rose 29.7 points (or 0.28%) in the six days, this represented a relative price increase of 12.8%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on UMS Holdings, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051921770314780 Bullish SignalsUptrend- The stock increased on firm volume, rising for a sixth consecutive day.- The stock hit a year-high 12th time in one month and 17th time in three months.- The stock continues its significant uptrend.- Rises to Falls: in the past month the number of rises outnumbered falls 11:5 or 2.2:1.- The present value of SGD1,000 (PV$1000) invested one year ago in UMS Holdings is SGD1,794, including a capital gain of SGD633 and dividend reinvested of SGD161. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Earnings of 14.9 [17.0]. - Return on Equity 9.4% [7.5%].- Return on Assets 8% [3.2%].- Return on Capital Employed 10.3% [9.1%].- Dividend yield of 6.8% [2.5%].Other Bullish Signals:- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 1.1 is comfortably below 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 12.9%. - Interest cover defined by EBIT/I is 71 times. This indicates it is less leveraged. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 1.2. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- Net profit margin has averaged 20.5% in the last 3 years. This is considered superior and suggests a high margin of safety.- The Enterprise Value/EBITDA multiple of 8.0 compares favourably with sector average of 8.6. Enterprise Value is estimated at MCap SGD252.7 million plus net debt of SGD-14.9 million and EBITDA is estimated at SGD29.5 million.- Economic Value Added defined by Net Operating Profit After Tax of SGD16.8 million less Cost of Capital of SGD4.9 million was SGD11.9 million. The multiple EVA/Cost of Capital was exemplary at 2.4 times. - As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity of 9.4% is better than sector average of 7.5%. This is computed as net profit margin of 15.0% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.53 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 1.2. NoteVolume: there were 1,744,000 shares worth SGD1.3 million (US$1 million) traded. This has been propped up by firm volume of 1.5 times average. Bearish Signals:Overbought/Bearish/Resistance Signals- The Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 76.9 has penetrated the overbought line of 70, suggesting the price gain of 11.4% in the last 14 days is unusually high. - The Money Flow Index [MFI] is 88.1 suggesting an overbought 14-day trend, being above 80. The Money Ratio of 7.4 suggests positive money flow was 7.4 times negative money flow.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price/Sales of 2.2 [0.5]. - Price to Book of 2.6 [1.6]. - Price to EBITDA of 8.6 [6.9].Other Bearish Signals:- Revenue and Net Profit growth have shown signs of deterioration in recent quarters.[Quarter ended, all figures in %] - EBITDA growth has seen consecutive falls and seems to be on a slippery slope in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
